summary: This document is a chain of emails from late June 2019 arranging a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It involves FBI personnel from the New York office and the Victim Services Division coordinating schedules and logistics for the call, which was set for June 28, 2019, at 2:00 PM Eastern Time. The emails also mention a separate in-person meeting at the SDNY (Southern District of New York) on July 1, 2019.

persons.name: Connell
persons.context: Supervises CAFIs (Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers) and is copied on the email chain to discuss Epstein victim interviews.

persons.name: Watson, P.
persons.context: FBI agent from the New York office copied on the email chain regarding the Epstein victim interviews conference call.

connections.description: Connell is described as supervising CAFIs (Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers), which includes J.
Both are FBI personnel involved in coordinating the Epstein victim interviews discussion.

events.title: Epstein Victim Interviews Conference Call
events.description: A scheduled unclassified conference call at 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case, involving FBI personnel from NY and the Victim Services Division.

events.title: SDNY Meeting and ADIC Case Brief
events.description: A 2:00 PM meeting at the Southern District of New York (SDNY) is mentioned, followed by a case brief requested by the ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge) at 3:30 PM, creating a hard stop for the earlier meeting.

locations: FBI NY Criminal Division Violent Crimes Task Force
FBI, Victim Services Division Child Victim Services Unit
keyFacts: The FBI was actively coordinating victim interviews in the Epstein case as of June-July 2019, involving personnel from the New York office and the specialized Child Victim Services Unit.
A specific unclassified conference call was scheduled for June 28, 2019, at 2:00 PM ET to discuss the victim interview strategy.
The email chain indicates coordination between operational agents and forensic interview specialists, highlighting a multi-disciplinary approach to the investigation.
The correspondence references a separate, high-level case brief requested by the ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge) for July 1, 2019, at 3:30 PM, indicating ongoing oversight.
Several email addresses and names are partially redacted or shown only by initials, suggesting the involvement of additional individuals not fully named in the released text.
